Gick upp och åkte ner för att hitta vart på sluttningen det fanns mest mjuk snö/drevsnö. Svårt att få ner sonden mer än 1.5 meter pga hårt snötäcke. Tror 47-48 P- kan vara det gamla Df2 som det gått laviner i tidigare.
Nýfallið flóð og nokkur dags gömul úr eggjum og niður í skálina. Brotstál þess stærsta er 30-40 cm.
Strong winds were blowing up by 10am when I was departing. Calm at start

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Tapulin laella voimakas etelätuuli. Pitin tekopaikalla lähes tyyntä. Ylempänä lumi liikkui kohti pohjoista rolling. Pitin päällä painetta antaessa lumipeite murtui noin 40 down. Talven tiivein lumi tällä sektorilla toistaiseksi. Lumikiteet pyöristymässä.

Pit_Observation.activities: Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
Very stable conditions observed at this location and likely at all other locations similar in altitude and not wind-loaded from the latest storm. There is no wind loading here from this past storm, which dropped 8cm of new snow. Most layers have bonded very well together, likely due to the warm temps hovering around freezing for the past month.
Locations higher up that were subject to more wind loading during the latest snowfall may be more unstable!
Pit dug in lee of vegetation at treeline

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown; Poor pit location;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Brottkantprofil för Na2 med 70-140 cm brottkant. Efter testet såg jag en delvis överdrevad spricka 15 meter från profilen högre upp i sluttningen. Testet är inte representativt eftersom flaket redan hade kollapsat. Lavinens svaga lager ner 51 cm i profilen.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: If you isolate the bottom crust, defeating the bridge, the columns fail 100% on the basal facets. Realistically causing a failure below the crust is pretty fanciful. It was supportive to boot pen. The surface hoar failed in conjunction with the facets sitting on the crust in tests. The PST was most reactive on the buried surface hoar. ECT blocks were 100cm and 120cm wide yielding same results.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Due to depth and resources available, stability tests were inconclusive, one CT18 broke around 70 cm. 2x ECTX, but unable to isolate to the 70 cm interface. Upon removal, upper meter-plus of columns did not readily break and was very confidence inspiring.
Marknära drev.
ALP bredvid stor hängdriva. Drevsnö stabilitet och utbredning.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is representative of backcountry;
Snowmobile tracks on slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Large avalanche about 1400 ft wide that broke above a crust at 130cm. Layers in crown face heavily affected by winds. Strong sunshine made it hard to identify the weak layer as crystals were melting on my crystal card. At a sheltered slope nearby on a similar aspect and elevation, facets above the crust were obvious and 0.5-1.0mm. That layer produced ECTP11 and 15. Photo below from snowpit nearby.
Clearing in NTL zone

Cracking;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: ALP, perfekt liten formation för att vara lä för ostvinden. Sondade all terräng på sluttningen som var flackare än 35 grader. Det ganska nya flaket var som tjockast ca 30 cm. Tydliga sprickor, men bara ovanför egna skidspår. Letade med ljus och lykta efter tydliga FC under skaren, men enstaka tydliga DF och enstaka kantiga runda.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown; Collapsing, widespread; Cracking; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit dug by Griffin Dittmar and Sean Jorgenson in the crown of an explosive triggered avalanche classified as: SS-R4-D3-O. The trigger point was in the top of the run out of the slide path. The Avalanche broke above the MFcr @25cm above the ground. The avalanche propagated appropriately 1000-1200ft wide through several slide paths and ran approximately 750ft. The crown was 1-2 feet where the profile was dug. Alpha angle measured at 27 degrees.

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes:
Friends of the Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center Techs: Davis / Hilland
"While we've noticed some indications of compression failures within the recent snow layers in the area, we haven't observed any signs of widespread instability within our snow profile. - Avalanche conditions are generally safe at present, with the likelihood of both natural and human-triggered avalanches being low. The snowpack appears stable overall, though it's important to note that a LOW rating doesn't guarantee the absence of avalanche risk in specific terrain. Exercise caution during travel, remain alert to weather changes, and be vigilant for unstable snow near isolated terrain features."

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; We skied slope;
Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: This is a crown profile for a human-triggered avalanche that caught, carried, and buried 2 skiers. No injuries. The profile was done a day after the incident which occurred on 20240218. On the day of the incident it was snowing with westerly wind.
